intro: Gymnadenia pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean grass-of-Parnassus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the Pyrenees mountains and surrounding regions in Europe. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Gymnadenia pyrenaica is a perennial species that plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
